page.title: 15THE ALLOTMENTS IN GRASSMOOR.
page.content: An allotment is an area of land which can be rented from the council by people who are interested in growing flowers and vegetables. The secretary of the Grassmoor Allotment Association said they were first started in 1913. Gardeners get either a small plot of 300 square metres or a larger one twice the size. There are many glass greenhouses growing tomatoes, cucumbers and a few melons. There are patches of mint, sage and parsley and some fruit bushes like raspberries, strawberries, black currants, redcurrants and gooseberries One gardener has planted a large patch of tobacco plants and was going to prepare the leaves for smoking in his pipe. Almost every type of vegetable is grown and many plots are filled with chrysanthemums. Competitions are held to see who grows the best plants.
